definition: to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

sentences.english: JiaBu saying that he himself is to serve the hierarch commands, let let ying ying dont talk nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 贾布说自己是奉了教主的命令，让任盈盈不要瞎说。

sentences.english: After we broke up, he would call me and talk rubbish .
sentences.chinese: 我们分手后，他会打电话给我，瞎说。

sentences.english: His story is total rubbish; I don't believe any of it.
sentences.chinese: 他的故事都是瞎说，我一点儿都不信。

sentences.english: It seemed to me that Sir Robert's arguments were nonsensical.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，罗伯特爵士的争辩纯属瞎说。

sentences.english: He gave me some cock-and-bull story about having to be at his cousin's engagement party.
sentences.chinese: 他对我瞎说他一定得去参加他表弟的订婚宴会。

definition: to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to make a wild guess/blind guess
to boast/to shoot one's mouth off
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
to speak without thinking/to blurt sth out
